channel.title: Git on Ordinary Tech Chronicle
channel.description: Recent content in Git on Ordinary Tech Chronicle

item.title: Git delete remote branch
item.description: As of Git v1.7.0, you can delete a remote branch using git push origin --delete <branchName> src = stackoverflow.com

item.title: GIT – stop tracking files
item.description: If you have some files that you need to have in your repo but don’t need to have updates, git allows it : git update-index --skip-worktree <FILES> Then a “git status” won’t show those files until you do : git update-index --no-skip-worktree <FILES> To show the skipped files : git ls-files -v . | grep ^S –skip-worktree is a better solution than –assume-unchanged because status will not get lost once an upstream change is pulled.
